The human genome contains 20,535 unique protein‐coding genes that vary greatly in size (data retrieved from Ensembl Biomart [GENCODE v19, GRCH37p13]
44 ). The distribution of human gene length has a long tail encompassing extremely long genes in the mega base pair (bp) range (Figure 1A). After log‐transformation, 272 genes have a log bp size of more than two standard deviations above the mean and are designated as the set of “very long” genes (Figure 1B and Supplementary Table 1).
